designScenario.description: The Rain Protection System is engineered to mitigate the adverse effects of heavy rainfall and water accumulation on critical aircraft surfaces such as windshields, sensor arrays, and other exposed control surfaces. By integrating advanced raindrop detection sensors, a hydrophobic surface application mechanism, and an active water ejection system, the Rain Protection System ensures optimal visibility, sensor performance, and overall aircraft safety during adverse weather conditions. The system continuously monitors environmental parameters and dynamically engages protective measures to prevent water-induced aerodynamic performance losses.
designScenario.name: Rain Protection System

details.description: The system shall detect rainfall intensity using a network of optical and capacitive sensors integrated into the aircraft’s sensor array.
Upon detection of rain above the predefined intensity threshold, protective measures shall be automatically activated.
The system must initiate protective measures within 3 seconds of detecting critical rainfall levels.
Maintain optimal surface conditions to ensure clear visibility and sensor integrity during heavy rain.
The system must incorporate redundant control circuits and fallback procedures to maintain operation even if a sensor or actuator fails.
In the event of component failure, isolate the faulty module without compromising the overall rain protection capability.
The user interface for system monitoring and maintenance must comply with ergonomic and aviation human factors standards.
System maintenance documentation and upgrade capabilities should be accessible and compliant with industry standards.
